verses.verse: “This also causes my heart to tremble and to leap out of its place.
Listen to the thunder of God’s voice and the rumbling that comes forth from his mouth.
He sends it forth across the heavens, along with his lightning to the ends of the earth.
Following this, there comes a roaring sound, as God thunders with his majestic voice, and he does not restrain his flashes of lightning when his voice is heard.
“At God’s command marvels come to pass; he performs wonders beyond our ability to comprehend.
For he says to the snow, ‘Fall upon the earth,’ and to the rain shower, ‘Turn into a heavy downpour.’
All human activity comes to a standstill so that everyone may acknowledge his power.
Wild beasts return to their lairs and take shelter in their dens.
“The tempest comes out of its chamber, and the north winds bring bitter cold.
By the breath of God[a] ice is formed and the surface of the waters becomes frozen.
He weighs down the thick clouds with moisture, and they scatter his lightning.
Following his command they blow about over the face of the entire earth to do whatever he directs.
Whether for correction of his people or for love, he causes all this to happen.
“Listen to my words, O Job; stop and reflect upon the marvelous works of God.
Do you know how God controls the clouds, or how he makes his lightning flash?
Do you know how the clouds are balanced, the wondrous work of the one who is perfect in knowledge?
You who swelter in your stifling garments when the earth lies still under the south wind,
can you, like him, spread out the skies, hard as a mirror of cast metal?[b]
“Teach us, then, what we should say to him; because of ignorance, we cannot present our case.
Do my words have any effect on him? Is he informed of any man’s commands?
Sometimes the light vanishes, and the sky is overcast with clouds; then the wind comes and sweeps them away.
[c]“Out of the north golden splendor comes forth, and God is surrounded by awesome majesty.
But the Almighty we cannot find; he is unequaled in power and judgment, and in his righteousness he will not violate justice.
Therefore, men revere him, and all thoughtful men fear him.”
